page.title: 01The Block, Kinbrace
page.content: Our block is an area of moorland where two valleys meet. The valley floor is about 115 metres above sea level and there are land masses in the east and north west of the area rising to 300 metres. The valley floor is grassland and the slopes are heather clad with areas of afforestation. The landownership is divided between the two estates of Badanloch and Achentoul. Kinbrace, a small hamlet in the centre of the block, is a focal point with roads meeting from the north,the south and the west. These roads cross the railway line. Kinbrace is a service station with a school, two churches, shop,garage,post office and a railway request stop. The population of the block is twenty two all but one living in Kinbrace.
